attributes.action: keep the Rugby league Challenge Cup on free-to-air television
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Carnegie Challenge Cup is Rugby League’s most historic and prestigious competition and was first broadcast on free-to-air television in 1952. The Challenge Cup Final has been shown live on the BBC every year since 1958. It showcases to the world a sporting occasion where the exemplary conduct of fans and players epitomises the very best of British and is admired and respected by millions. We the undersigned urge you to reject the recommendation to remove the Rugby League Challenge Cup Final from the free-to-air list.
